core_definition.goal: Streamline workflows, reduce manual work, protect decision-maker's time
core_definition.pain: Tool complexity, manual CRM updates, too many features without clear guidance
core_definition.success: Simple tools that just work, automation that saves time, easy setup

critical_role_in_buying.note: This persona is the GATEKEEPER in most deals. They do the hands-on evaluation, test the product, and recommend to the decision-maker. Losing them = losing the deal.

operations_manager.description: Manages team efficiency and tool stack, evaluates on behalf of leadership

distinguishing_traits.quote_example: I feel like this is a garage full of tools... all I need is a hammer and a screwdriver

technical_ops.description: Manages complex tech stack, builds workflows and automations

distinguishing_traits.quote_example: I work here, I go home, and then I work some more

sdm_manager.description: Manages SDR/BDR team, hybrid ops and coaching role

distinguishing_traits.quote_example: When I became the outbound manager in June, we cleaned house and hired four new people

complexity_tolerance.note: Low tolerance personas will abandon if not 'Apple easy'

typical_pain_points: 45 minutes of effort with no results = abandonment
Too many features without clear guidance on which to use
Unclear syntax or configuration (e.g., double-bracket completions)
Protecting decision-maker's time means doing evaluation heavy lifting
Comparison to simpler alternatives (Fathom does it in a minute)
typical_fears: Will have to support this tool on top of everything else
Learning curve will slow me down without clear payoff
Product complexity will frustrate my team
AI will write garbage data to CRM at scale
Can't audit or explain what the AI did
typical_voice_quotes: My god's honest feedback is it's not easy. I'm sitting here trying to do my homework for you, and it's like, what am I doing here? This doesn't make me money.
I feel like this is a garage full of tools, and I don't know what any of them do... all I need is a hammer and a screwdriver, like a college dorm room tool bag.
I think the engineers overbuilt your product here, dude. I could learn it... I truly believe I'm smart enough, but I'm too lazy to really do it.
It's missing something, Parker... it just wasn't Apple easy to use.
Even with Fathom, it's not as automated as you guys, but I can just ask the question in a minute... and it does it perfect.
That's why I took this off of Kim's calendar because she's in half hour back to back for thirty consecutive hours a week.
Show me the audit trail or I can't approve it.

behavioral_patterns.first_click_tendency: Tries to figure it out themselves, explores settings/config
behavioral_patterns.error_response: Investigates root cause, documents, then escalates if needed
behavioral_patterns.help_seeking: Prefers independent learning, then checks docs, then asks support
behavioral_patterns.abandonment_trigger: 45 minutes without clear progress OR first time it corrupts data
behavioral_patterns.evaluation_style: Hands-on testing, side-by-side comparison with alternatives

usability_expectations.self_service_preference: Wants to do it themselves but ONLY if simple
usability_expectations.support_fallback: Will accept support help if self-service is too hard
usability_expectations.quote: I could learn it, but it just feels like my recommendation is we wait and check back
